LanguageData.VME_Violence_Honorable.label: honorable
LanguageData.VME_Violence_Honorable.description:
Harming innocents is an honorable necessity on the Rim, it proves our strength and our resolve.

<color=#E5E54C>Gameplay effect:</color>
 - Colonists will receive a positive mood if they are forced to attack non-hostile humanoid targets.
LanguageData.VME_Violence_Acceptable.label: acceptable
LanguageData.VME_Violence_Acceptable.description: Violence is just a fact of life.
LanguageData.VME_Violence_Disapproved.label: disapproved
LanguageData.VME_Violence_Disapproved.description:
We should avoid harming innocents if possible. Attacking a harmless person is immoral. 

<color=#E5E54C>Gameplay effect:</color>
 - Colonists will receive a negative mood if they are forced to attack non-hostile humanoid targets.
LanguageData.VME_Violence_Abhorrent.label: abhorrent
LanguageData.VME_Violence_Abhorrent.description:
To shed blood or break bone is barbaric and disgusting. 

<color=#E5E54C>Gameplay effect:</color>
 - Colonists will receive a substantial negative mood if they are forced to attack non-hostile humanoid targets.
 - The only mental break allowed is psychotic wander.
 - All drafted colonists will undraft if an attacking enemy starts fleeing.
